subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Myth Is Not a Lie
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Myth Is Not a Lie.

hook.text: We use 'myth' to mean 'false.' But myths were never meant to be facts. They carry truths that facts alone cannot.

buildup.text: Myths encode moral values, psychological insights, and cultural identity. They're compressed wisdom, not naive science.

discovery.text: The Garden of Eden isn't a geography lesson. It's about innocence, knowledge, and the cost of growing up.

twist.text: Treating myths as literal history misses the point. But dismissing them as lies misses it even more.

climax.text: Myths are true in the way that poetry is true. They illuminate human experience, not physical reality.

punchline.text: Myths aren't facts or lies. They're truths that only stories can carry.

quiz.question: What is the proper way to understand myth?
options: As compressed wisdom about human experience
